parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The transmission hesitation and failure can cause the vehicle to stall or jerk, leading to accidents or near-misses, especially when merging into traffic or accelerating from a stop.
symptoms: The vehicle hesitates or stalls when accelerating
the transmission jerks or hesitates when shifting gears
the vehicle rolls backward when removing foot from brake to accelerator
the vehicle has a delayed response to accelerator input
the vehicle has a sudden loss of power.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The driveshaft malfunction can cause the vehicle to shake violently, leading to loss of control and accidents, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: The vehicle shakes violently at high speeds
the driveshaft breaks or fails
the vehicle veers into oncoming traffic or nearby lanes.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The timing chain failure can cause the engine to misfire, leading to loss of power and accidents, especially when driving at high speeds.
symptoms: The engine misfires
the check engine light illuminates
the vehicle has a rough idle
the timing chain wears out prematurely.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The oil leak can cause the engine to fail, leading to accidents or strandings, especially if the leak is not addressed promptly.
symptoms: The vehicle drips oil
the oil leak is intermittent
the oil leak is only present when the engine is hot.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The clutch and accelerator pedal failure can cause the vehicle to stall or hesitate, leading to accidents or near-misses, especially when accelerating from a stop.
symptoms: The clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
the accelerator pedal does not respond
the vehicle stalls or hesitates when accelerating.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The faulty passenger occupancy sensor can cause the seat belt light to remain on even when there is no passenger, which can lead to safety concerns regarding airbag deployment.
symptoms: The seat belt light remains on after a passenger has exited the vehicle
the airbag light indicator may be on or off
and the only way to turn off the seat belt light is to put the passenger seat belt on or turn the car on and off.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the solenoid switch can cause the timing chain to fail, leading to engine damage and potentially catastrophic consequences.
symptoms: A squealing noise coming from the engine
the timing chain failure
and the solenoid switch failure.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system can cause the vehicle to fail to start, leading to safety concerns and potentially leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: The vehicle fails to start
the battery dies
the lights fail
and the vehicle automatically locks
trapping the driver inside.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Front Passenger Airbag Occupancy Sensor Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front passenger airbag occupancy sensor can cause the inactivation of the front passenger airbag, leaving the passenger without protection in the event of an accident, which can increase the risk of injury or fatality.
symptoms: The airbag light illuminates on the dashboard
the front passenger airbag is inactivated
the airbag light stays on for various periods of time (e.g.
5 minutes
3 minutes
13 minutes)
the airbag light turns off and then comes back on after restarting the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the 4WAS and stability control system can cause the rear of the vehicle to feel unstable, leading to loss of control, accidents, and potential injuries.
symptoms: The 4WAS and stability control warning lights come on while driving over rough asphalt or during turns
the rear of the vehicle feels unstable
the steering wheel is off-center
the vehicle's steering is difficult or unpredictable.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Inaccurate Diagnosis and Ineffective Repair by Dealerships
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Inaccurate diagnosis and ineffective repair by dealerships can lead to continued safety risks, financial losses, and frustration for vehicle owners.
symptoms: Dealerships recommend replacing the HICAS actuator and/or 4WAS control box
but the problem persists
owners are left with unnecessary repair costs
and the underlying issue remains unresolved.
